ValidationActions.P: Annotations can be marked-up in a document or publication.
Articles can be marked-up in a document or publication.
Boxes can be marked-up in a document or publication.
Chapters can be marked-up in a document or publication.
Documents can be marked-up in a document or publication.
Parts used for chapter grouping before publication is produced.
Sections can be marked-up in a document or publication.
Volumes can be marked-up in a publication.
Abstracts can be marked-up in a document chapter or publication chapter.
Abstracts can be marked-up in a document or publication meta.
Abstracts can be marked-up in a document or publication section.
Acknowledgements can be marked-up in a document or publication.
Annexes can be marked-up in a document or publication.
Appendices can be marked-up in a document or publication.
A Bibliography can be marked-up in a document or publication.
A Bibliography can be marked-up using simple mods or complex structures depending on implementaion.
Bibliography sections can be marked-up in a document or publication.
Conclusions can be marked-up in a document or publication.

Section.Objective: Extracts are typically a new concept. It could be claimed that they are derived from a DITA mindset, however authoring practices show that this is a disiplne that has been used by writes for a long time. What we intend to do at the OECD with extract si promote content re-use and correctness of information.

ValidationActions.P: Markup of an extract to piece of externl content using it's native namespace and embedded inline.
Markup of an extract to a external piece of content.
Executive Summaries can be marked-up in a document chapter or publication chapter.
Forewords can be marked-up in a document chapter or publication chapter.
Introduciotns can be marked-up in a document or publication or in document chapter or publication chapter.
Prefaces can be marked-up in a document chapter or publication chapter.
Graphic souerces can be marked-up in a document chapter or publication chapter.
Figure sources can be marked-up in a document chapter or publication chapter.
Table sources can be marked-up in a document chapter or publication chapter.
Agenda sections containg sessions and items can be marked-up in an Agenda.
Agenda sessions and items can be marked-up in an Agenda.

Test.Objective: Check if different case of standard tables have an equivalent content model.

ValidationActions.P: Check that citations can be marked up.

Test.Objective: Markup of inline Quotes using tags or punctuation

ValidationActions.P: Check that quotes can be encoded using tags or punctuation.

Test.Objective: Check if different case of standard tables have an equivalent content model.

ValidationActions.P: Check the tables are well converted
Check the tables are well converted in all section (chapter, section level 1 or level 2 or level 3, annex) contexts.

IntegrationTests.Purpose: Test compound Official Documents, Publications and Agendas.
IntegrationTests.Objective: Check the structure of entire documents, publications and agendas.

Section.Objective: Check the mapping of the conversion from od to op, with a complete official document (TAD)
Check the mapping from op content model to narrdoc, with a complete standard publication (economic survey)
Check the markup of agendas with the op content model for simple and complex agendas.

Section.Purpose: Test performance and processing of documents
Section.Objective: Check the performance during the conversion of documents to publications, a really big document ( 50 000 + lines).
Check the structure of entire documents, publications and agendas in the QXA model.
Check the mapping of Publicaiotns in QXA
Check the mapping of Agendas in QXA
Check the markup of agendas with the op content model for simple and complex agendas.

Section.Purpose: Test performance and processing of documents
Section.Objective: Check the performance during the conversion of documents to publications, a really big document ( 50 000 + lines).
